conclusion: To determine the distance fallen, calculate the area under the v-t graph from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds.
From t = 0 to t = 10 seconds, the graph shows a curve that starts at 0 m/s and increases to 20 m/s.
The area under the curve can be approximated by calculating the area of a trapezoid.
The trapezoidal rule for the area under the curve is given by: Area = 1/2 * (Base1 + Base2) * Height.
Base1 = 0 m/s (initial velocity), Base2 = 20 m/s (final velocity), and Height = 10 s (time interval).
The area under the curve from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds is exactly 100 meters.
